meanings.sent1: She will initiate the game by throwing the ball first.
meanings.sent2: Let's initiate the project with a brainstorming session.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to initiate a conversation with the dog by meowing.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise seemed to initiate a new day full of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to initiate their homework as soon as they got home.

meanings.definition: To admit or introduce into a group or organization
meanings.sent1: The club will initiate new members at the next meeting.
meanings.sent2: Please initiate the new employee by showing them around the office.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to initiate the rabbit into the hat, but it was too big.
meanings.sent4: The key will initiate access to the secret room in the castle.
meanings.sent5: The password is required to initiate the login process on the computer.

meanings.definition: A person who has been initiated into a group or organization
meanings.sent1: He became an initiate of the fraternity after completing the initiation ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The initiates were excited to finally be part of the exclusive club.
meanings.sent3: The initiate accidentally spilled juice on the initiation robes.
meanings.sent4: The initiate's dedication to the group was evident in their actions.
meanings.sent5: The initiate proudly wore the symbol of the organization on their jacket.
